DataElement.preferredName: Syringe And/Or Vial Portion Administered Type
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A description of the syringe and or vial portion that was administered.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A device for the administration of drug products that consists of a rigid barrel fitted with septum with a plunger at one end and a seal or needle at the other end. The needle assembly may be part of the device or separate._Used to indicate that either or both of two items or options may be valid._A small, often stoppered glass or plastic bottle for holding fluids._One of the portions into which something is regarded as divided and which together constitute a whole.:The act of having given something (e.g., a medication or test).

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A device for the administration of drug products that consists of a rigid barrel fitted with septum with a plunger at one end and a seal or needle at the other end. The needle assembly may be part of the device or separate._Used to indicate that either or both of two items or options may be valid._A small, often stoppered glass or plastic bottle for holding fluids._One of the portions into which something is regarded as divided and which together constitute a whole.

Concepts.definition: A device for the administration of drug products that consists of a rigid barrel fitted with septum with a plunger at one end and a seal or needle at the other end. The needle assembly may be part of the device or separate.
Used to indicate that either or both of two items or options may be valid.
A small, often stoppered glass or plastic bottle for holding fluids.
One of the portions into which something is regarded as divided and which together constitute a whole.
The act of having given something (e.g., a medication or test).

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: actions or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process (NCI).

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: One of the portions into which something is regarded as divided and which together constitute a whole._The act of having given something (e.g., a medication or test)._Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.
